definition.value: a part of an occurrence of a disease process which is associated with position in the normal progression of the disease

name: disease stage
body: a part of an occurrence of a disease process which is associated with position in the normal progression of the disease

definition.value: A disease stage which is preceded by a remission and characterized by the return of a manifestation of a disease.

term editor.value:
Albert Goldfain
Richard Scheuermann
Sagar Jain

editor note.value: A pathological bodily process which is part of a disease couse that occurs after an incomplete remission and that is similar to earlier parts of the disease course.

children.name: relapse
children.body: A disease stage which is preceded by a remission and characterized by the return of a manifestation of a disease.

definition.value: A disease stage which is characterized by the lack of a manifestation of a disease

term editor.value:
Albert Goldfain
Richard Scheuermann
Sagar Jain

editor note.value: A part of a disease course in which the extent or rate of change of the signs and symptoms of a disorder has decreased.

children.name: remission
children.body: A disease stage which is characterized by the lack of a manifestation of a disease

definition.value: A remission which is characterized by a prolonged lack of all manifestations of a disease

children.name: complete remission
children.body: A remission which is characterized by a prolonged lack of all manifestations of a disease

definition.value: A remission which is characterized by a prolonged lack of some manifestations of a disease

children.name: partial remission
children.body: A remission which is characterized by a prolonged lack of some manifestations of a disease

definition.value: A disease stage that marks the beginning of a disease

children.name: onset
children.body: A disease stage that marks the beginning of a disease

definition.value: A disease stage with a rapid unfolding of signs and symptoms

children.name: acute onset
children.body: A disease stage with a rapid unfolding of signs and symptoms

definition.value: A disease stage characterized by the lack of symptoms associated with a given disease

children.name: asymptomatic
children.body: A disease stage characterized by the lack of symptoms associated with a given disease

definition.value: A cancer progression stage characterized by abnormal cellular growth contained within normal tissue boundaries (e.g. carcinoma in situ).

children.name: cancer progression stage 0
children.body: A cancer progression stage characterized by abnormal cellular growth contained within normal tissue boundaries (e.g. carcinoma in situ).

definition.value: A cancer progression stage characterized by abnormal cellular growth that extends through normal local tissue boundaries as a contiguous mass.

children.name: cancer progression stage I
children.body: A cancer progression stage characterized by abnormal cellular growth that extends through normal local tissue boundaries as a contiguous mass.

definition.value: A cancer progression stage characterized by abnormal cellular growth that extends well beyond normal local tissue boundaries as a contiguous mass.

children.name: cancer progression stage II
children.body: A cancer progression stage characterized by abnormal cellular growth that extends well beyond normal local tissue boundaries as a contiguous mass.

definition.value: A cancer progression stage characterized by abnormal cellular growth that extends through normal local tissue boundaries as a contiguous mass and includes metastasis to one or more regional draining lymph nodes.

children.name: cancer progression stage III
children.body: A cancer progression stage characterized by abnormal cellular growth that extends through normal local tissue boundaries as a contiguous mass and includes metastasis to one or more regional draining lymph nodes.

definition.value: A cancer progression stage characterized by abnormal cellular growth that extends through normal local tissue boundaries as a contiguous mass and includes metastasis to other distant tissues besides lymph nodes.

children.name: cancer progression stage IV
children.body: A cancer progression stage characterized by abnormal cellular growth that extends through normal local tissue boundaries as a contiguous mass and includes metastasis to other distant tissues besides lymph nodes.
